questions.text: The first dam in the TVA system to go into operation was in what state?
questions.explanation:
Alabama.

	The TVA was established in 1933, mainly to control floods and to produce electricity. It effects seven states.

questions.text: In 1939, the United States refused to export what gas to Germany?
questions.explanation:
Helium.

	It was the year Germany invaded Poland and the United States claimed to be neutral.

questions.text: What college was Tom Harmon a famous football star at?
questions.explanation:
University of Michigan.

	He had national fame from 1938-1940. His position was tailback.

questions.text: What scrappy in-fielder was called the 'Fordham Flash'?
questions.explanation:
Frank Frisch.

	Four winning pennants with the New York Giants and four winning pennants with the St. Louis Cardinals.

questions.text: The Empire State Building opened in 1931. How many stories did it have?
questions.explanation:
102.

	It is located in New York City and was the first large skyscraper.

questions.text: Fred Waring, the designer of the Waring Blender, was also a conductor of choral music.
questions.explanation:
True.

	His group was called Fred Waring and the Pennsylvanians and he was known as the man who "taught America how to sing".

questions.text: Jack Armstrong 'The All American Boy' was a radio series. What sport did he play?
questions.explanation:
Football.

	Not to be confused with a real life football star.

questions.text: In 1934, who was Public Enemy Number 1?
questions.explanation:
John Dillinger.

	He was shot dead outside the Biograph Theater in Chicago in 1934.

questions.text: Whose theme song was 'When The Moon Comes Over The Mountain'?
questions.explanation:
Kate Smith.

	She was known as the first lady of radio and was closely associated with the song 'God Bless America'.

questions.text: Who was 'Time' magazine's 'Man Of The Year' in 1938?
questions.explanation:
Hitler.

	His 'Third Reich' was already a principal European power.
